d31d2a0dbca7ccd804f501ddef41d7d6 (07:50): is EDT the daylight savings version of EST?
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (07:50): depends which country you're in, but it's a reasonable assumption
d31d2a0dbca7ccd804f501ddef41d7d6 (07:50): US :-)
d31d2a0dbca7ccd804f501ddef41d7d6 (07:50): (well i'm not in the US, but...)
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (07:50): _river_: here in Aus we generally use AEST and AEDT  - Aus Eastern {Standard|Daylight} Time
d31d2a0dbca7ccd804f501ddef41d7d6 (07:51): someone in the US told me to call them after 10AM EST
d31d2a0dbca7ccd804f501ddef41d7d6 (07:51): but the current time in America/New_York seems to be EDT
d31d2a0dbca7ccd804f501ddef41d7d6 (07:51): so i'm a bit confused
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (07:51): they mean US/Eastern
